docs.abstract: The company said it would increase rates for its 58 million subscribers in the United States 13 to 18 percent, its biggest increase since it started its streaming service 12 years ago.
docs.snippet: The company said it would increase rates for its 58 million subscribers in the United States 13 to 18 percent, its biggest increase since it started its streaming service 12 years ago.

headline.main: Netflix Is Raising Prices. Here’s Why.
headline.print_headline: Why Netflix’s Prices Are Going Up

docs.abstract: There are many eco-conscious steps to take around your tech, says John Schwartz, a climate reporter. Tech can also help us see the scope of climate change.
docs.snippet: There are many eco-conscious steps to take around your tech, says John Schwartz, a climate reporter. Tech can also help us see the scope of climate change.
docs.lead_paragraph: How do New York Times journalists use technology in their jobs and in their personal lives? John Schwartz, a climate reporter, discussed the tech he’s using.

headline.main: Tech’s Environmental Impact and What You Can Do About It
headline.print_headline: Limiting the Environmental Costs of Technology

docs.abstract: The plan includes $1 billion for an affordable housing investment fund as well as an effort to help first-time buyers.
docs.snippet: The plan includes $1 billion for an affordable housing investment fund as well as an effort to help first-time buyers.
docs.lead_paragraph: Apple on Monday announced a $2.5 billion plan to address the housing crisis in California, becoming the latest big tech company to devote money to a problem that local lawmakers and economists believe it helped create.

headline.main: Apple Commits $2.5 Billion to Ease California Housing Crunch
headline.print_headline: Apple’s $2.5 Billion Plan For Housing in California

byline.original: By Jack Nicas, Kevin Granville and Conor Dougherty

docs.abstract: Attorney General Xavier Becerra is in Google and Facebook’s backyard. But unlike nearly all other state attorneys general, he won’t say whether he’s investigating them.
docs.snippet: Attorney General Xavier Becerra is in Google and Facebook’s backyard. But unlike nearly all other state attorneys general, he won’t say whether he’s investigating them.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — When numerous state attorneys general gathered last month on the steps of the Supreme Court to announce an antitrust investigation into Google, one was conspicuously absent: Xavier Becerra, California’s attorney general.

headline.main: California Attorney General Is a No-Show on Tech Investigations
headline.print_headline: California’s Top Attorney  Is Quiet in Big Tech Battle

docs.abstract: Google’s Pixel 4 is the newest example of how computational photography is driving the future of phone cameras.
docs.snippet: Google’s Pixel 4 is the newest example of how computational photography is driving the future of phone cameras.
docs.lead_paragraph: Not too long ago, tech giants like Apple and Samsung raved about the number of megapixels they were cramming into smartphone cameras to make photos look clearer. Nowadays, all the handset makers are shifting focus to the algorithms, artificial intelligence and special sensors that are working together to make our photos look more impressive.

headline.main: The Reason Your Photos Are About to Get a Lot Better
headline.print_headline: Photos by Smartphones Make a Leap in Quality

docs.abstract: Apple TV Plus arrives Friday with “The Morning Show,” starring Reese Witherspoon and Jennifer Aniston, as its flagship streaming program.
docs.snippet: Apple TV Plus arrives Friday with “The Morning Show,” starring Reese Witherspoon and Jennifer Aniston, as its flagship streaming program.
docs.lead_paragraph: After all that — the billions spent, the deals with Big Bird, Oprah and Spielberg, the firing of a key producer, the secrecy, the breathless speculation — the moment is here. Apple is ready to take on Netflix, Amazon and Disney in the increasingly crowded entertainment industry.

headline.main: Apple Enters Show Business With a Black-Carpet Premiere

docs.abstract: A glitch in the video and audio calling app, which the company says it will fix, can turn the device into one perhaps better suited for espionage.
docs.snippet: A glitch in the video and audio calling app, which the company says it will fix, can turn the device into one perhaps better suited for espionage.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — The iPhone as an eavesdropping device? Watch out. It can happen.

headline.main: In a Stumble for Apple, a FaceTime Bug Lets iPhone Users Eavesdrop

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Wiretapping and Other Eavesdropping Devices and Methods

docs.abstract: Last year, with much fanfare, the tech giant unveiled a screen-time tracker of its own. Then it quietly began purging competitors from its store.
docs.snippet: Last year, with much fanfare, the tech giant unveiled a screen-time tracker of its own. Then it quietly began purging competitors from its store.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — They all tell a similar story: They ran apps that helped people limit the time they and their children spent on iPhones. Then Apple created its own screen-time tracker. And then Apple made staying in business very, very difficult.

headline.main: Apple Cracks Down on Apps That Fight iPhone Addiction

docs.abstract: The movement to reinterpret or change antimonopoly laws is running headlong into a legal community and interest groups just as invested in defending the status quo.
docs.snippet: The movement to reinterpret or change antimonopoly laws is running headlong into a legal community and interest groups just as invested in defending the status quo.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Thomas Lambert, a professor at the University of Missouri’s law school, gave his former colleague Josh Hawley a warning before Mr. Hawley became a senator in January.

headline.main: Powerful Coalition Pushes Back on Anti-Tech Fervor
headline.print_headline: Push Meets Pushback On Anti-Tech Fervor

docs.abstract: What used to seem like a fight for world domination has now become an uneasy stalemate.
docs.snippet: What used to seem like a fight for world domination has now become an uneasy stalemate.
docs.lead_paragraph: What used to seem like a fight for world domination has now become an uneasy stalemate.

headline.main: We’re Stuck With the Tech Giants. But They’re Stuck With Each Other.
